dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A horribly deformed figure--hunchback, misshapen head--si on a stool in complete silhouette. This is RICK COOGAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you imagine it, Regis, Kathie Lee? One day I'm a hot young movie star, and the next day I'm a hideous mutant freak, covered with festering lesions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oddly, REGIS and KATHIE LEE are also in complete silhouet

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like my wife when she misses a mudpack!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The audience CRACKS UP. Kathie Lee pooh-poohs Regis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Regis! You're incorrigible! Ha- ha! (to Rick, she turns

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky, once you were the all- American boy next door, star of the beloved Hey Dude films. Now the very mention of your name makes children scream in terror. We've all read about your disturbing story. But the people want to hear it from you, Ricky Coogan. (SFX: children scream) Won't you tell us your story?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's kinda long, but okay. It all started when I signed a deal to be spokesman for the E.E.S. conglomerate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The E.E.S. logo--a large metal shoe with a bar across it, with the words "Everything Except Shoes" beneath. Widen t reveal RICHARD HERTZ, president of E.E.S., smiling rigidl camera. RICK COOGAN is next to him, also holding a stiff movie-star smile. FLASH! They shake hands as the EES photographer takes publicity shots. Off to one side, behi Hertz, are several EES EXECUTIVES. Behind Rick is his entourage: LAWYER, BODYGUARD, TRAINER, STYLIST, and SPIRI GUIDE. 2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Further off, at the boardroom table, four DODDERING OLD CORPORATE FARTS on the brink of death look on with glazed expressions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through a clenched smile) So, what kind of crap do you scumbags want me to peddle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything. Everything except shoes, of course. Hah hah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He laughs pathetically. Rick doesn't respond. Hertz nods a nearby EXECUTIVE who hands him some BEEF STICKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meaty Twig Beef Sticks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick takes them and holds them up to the camera. Smiles. Flash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helmet Head hair spray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes the hair spray and holds it up. Smile. Flash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The assistant carefully hands Hertz a pulsating metal container with lots of warnings and danger symbols on it. Hertz gives it to Rick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noxon 24 biogenetic neuro- fertilizer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick holds it up, then pushes it away in disgust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fertilizer? Ricky Coogan does not do ads for hi-tech cow shit. I'm a star, got it, Hertz? (to his aide) Rico, give these misguided clowns Tony Danza's phone number, and let's get the hell out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives the finger to the EES photographer, who obliging takes a picture. Hertz waves at him to get lost, and call after Rick who's headed to the door with his entourage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick. Wait! Only you can stand up to the radicals trying to keep Noxon from the struggling farmers whose very future depends on it. 3.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noxon? Wasn't that just banned?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only in the U.S....and Europe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I heard that shit's lethal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hertz lets out a big laugh. He shakes his head at Rick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick, Rick, Rick... You want proof? Fine. Just take a seat. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick nods to his entourage. They sit at the boardroom tab across from the EES execs. An easel behind Hertz shows a placard with a bar graph. Hertz whispers something to an aide, who scurries off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meet the head of our South American research facility, Juan Valdez.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The aide ushers in a handsome LATIN AMERICAN EXECUTIVE in natty three-piece suit and a sombrero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is George Ramirez.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever. He's worked with Noxon 24 every day for five years, and he's in fine shape. Aren't you, Juan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George glares at Hertz bitterly. Hertz stares him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I am fine. Me and my team in Santa Flan have--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Santa "Flan?" What kind of shitty name for a country is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is named for the patron saint of creamy desserts... As I was saying, we've worked very closely with Noxon... 4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick nods. We cut back to George, but he isn't George anymore. He has mutated into a similar looking actor, in same suit, the same sombrero, but shorter and swarthier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I personally supervised its development...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick furrows his brow. He's a little suspicious of George transformation, but just a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now George is even shorter, even swarthier. Yet another actor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I performed rigorous scientific tests. No potential danger was left uninvestigated...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick's suspicion is increasing. He looks over to Hertz, w feigns total innocence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George is now even shorter. Still another actor. His clothes are baggy, and the sombrero is starting to slide over his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The environmentalists are crackpots, all of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick looks at his entourage. Their mouths hang open in astonishment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George has now shrunk to near-midget proportions. The sombrero completely covers his head. When he takes it off we see he's now played by LINDA HUNT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's ridiculous, I tell you. Totally ridiculous!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick is ready to ask questions, but Hertz cuts him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Valdez. That will be all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George nods and heads back to his seat. As he passes behi Hertz, he can't resist sticking his thumbs in his ears an making a face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a second-- 5.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky, this is important. We're talking about a major threat to the EES image. How does 2 million dollars plus expenses sound?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The aide reveals a new placard on the easel. It reads "$2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, it sounds great, but--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear you. Make it five million-- (a new placard: 5 MILLION) that is, if the board agrees ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hertz reaches beside his chair and pulls a lever. The old geezers beside him raise their arms stiffly, as if they w being pulled by strands of fishing line, which they are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, it's unanimous. Well, what do you say, Ricky? Are you EES's "Man in Santa Flan?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick looks at his advisors--they look over at Linda Hunt, then emphatically shake their heads "NO." Rick looks at Hertz, who shows him five big fingers and grins. Rick bre into a big smile and gives Hertz his trademark thumbs up sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick stands in line at the luggage X-ray machine. He impatiently checks his watch as the X-RAY CHECKER chats h up. A CRAZED ANARCHIST holding a large bomb passes throug the security check unquestioned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My kids just loved you in "Hey Dude Three: The Final Countdown." We need more wholesome role models like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the fuck is Ernie? 6.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear WOMEN'S SCREAMS. They turn towards the noise and a bunch of STEWARDESSES scattering from a trendy young ca with a fake hand sticking out of his fly. This is ERNIE, Rick's buddy and resident court jester.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies! All I wanted was a manicure! Yah-ha-ha! (he sees Rick)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick pumps Ernie's third "hand." The miffed X-ray checker points to Rick's large carry-on bag as it emerges from th ray machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Coogan, is this your bag?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this your kid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He indicates the X-ray monitor, where we see the skeleton outline of a BUCKTOOTHED, BESPECTACLED 10 YEAR OLD KID cu up in Rick's bag. The kid waves. Rick and Ernie look at each other in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuey Gluck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bag bursts open, and out pops STUEY GLUCK, an obsessi young autograph hound toting a stack of scrapbooks and memorabilia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick! Rick! Look! I got a rare still from your high school production of The Glass Menagerie! Could you sign it for me? Please?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get the hell out of here! 7.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ernie nods and yanks the bag away from under Stuey. They away down the corridor. Stuey chases them, holding up an by 10 photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick! Wait up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick and Ernie run around a corner with Stuey in pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick! Remember the speech you gave at the Actors Forum for Social Justice!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds up a cassette player and hits play. It's Rick's speech.

dialogues.speaker: RICK'S VOICE, (FROM TAPE)
dialogues.text: If all the world is a stage, then let us shine the spotlight on truth, integrity, and a deep compassion for all life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave me alone, troll!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was before I got an entertainment lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quick, down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ernie leads Rick down an adjacent hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a dead end. Rick and Ernie are trapped. Ernie gives Rick a sheepish look. Stuey stands at the entrance of the hallway. He holds up a Time magazine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick! Rick! It says here Noxon's dangerous. Why are you lending your name to it? What's happened to you, Rick? You used to be good! And now... I just don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuey starts to cry. Rick looks guilty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't cry, Stuey, I'm still good. 8.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAM! A passing electric baggage cart nails Stuey at full speed and carries him off down the corridor, screaming bl murder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick and Ernie high five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SEXY STEWARDESS pours champagne for Rick and Ernie. The anarchist sits nearby with the bomb on his lap. Rick wink suggestively at the stewardess. She walks off, obviously interested. Rick raises his glass to Ernie, oozing sleazy confidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane hits turbulence, and Rick's drink flies up out his glass--he catches it as it comes down. Another STEWARDESS helps the Anarchist put his bomb in the overhe compartment. Ernie ogles her. She sneers at him. We hear the CAPTAIN'S voice on the loudspeaker.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, this is your captain speaking. To the right of the aircraft, you can see a great view of the Grand Canyon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the passengers crane their necks to the right.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: And to the left you can see a panic- stricken little troll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick turns to his window and flings open the shade to reveal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: on the wing, pressing his face up against the glass. He's holding up a publicity shot of Rick and screaming somethi we can't hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuey loses his grip and is whisked off the wing. Rick watches him fall into oblivion. 9.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relieved, he turns nonchalantly to Ernie, ignoring the ot horrified passengers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna eat your peanuts, Ernie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, you can have 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large haystack sits in the middle of a field. We hear Stuey's approaching scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUD! Stuey misses the haystack by a few feet. He hops to his feet and dusts himself off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm okay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BONK! His scrapbook falls into frame and beans him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the airliner lowering its landing gear as it makes final approach to the runway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we are Ernie, Santa Spam. World famous for loud music and hot sex!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me a few hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KA-BLOOEY! The plane explodes in a fireball. Swish-pan to reveal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing just outside the airport. A porter follows with their bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure glad that wasn't our plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ernie nods. They're distracted by the sound of chanting. They squint into the distance, where they see a group of chanting PROTESTERS--young "Save the Earth" types, latter hippies, kids, seniors, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EES mustn't stay! Take your toxic crap away! EES mustn't stay! (etc.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of their signs read--"Say No to Noxon!", "Coogan Go Home", "EES is killing our Earth!", "Ricky Coogan Sucks S (this one held by a nice LITTLE GIRL), "I Like Ike" (held a confused OLD MAN, shuffling around aimlessly), "Drink Pepsi" and finally...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Free Nelson Mandela"--we WIDEN to reveal the subheading: "Inside specially marked boxes." We keep WIDENING to reve that this is not on a protest placard, but a box of cerea some GUY is eating as he watches the protest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus! We better find the limo before these whale kissers chop us up and sell us for parts. (he spots the limo) There it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off to the side, away from the protesters, an unmarked li with tinted windows (and plates that say NOT EES) awaits. KEVIN, an EES exec, leans out the window and waves discre at Ricky. The stewardesses, looking tipsy, wave their bra out the back window invitingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ernie tries to grab Ricky by the arm, but he resists. He' looking at the protesters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a second...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His POV...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: standing in the center of the crowd of protesters, holdin MEGAPHONE to her mouth and chanting. She puts down the megaphone to rest, and we can see that she's powerfully beautiful, in a no-nonsense feminist kind of way. This is JULIE. Rick is smitten. 11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go, Rick. They're waitin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget them. I got a better idea. If I can just find the right disguise...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coog, those hippies'll tear us apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick spots a HEAVILY BANDAGED MAN limping out of the airp on crutches. Rick approaches him, waving a roll of bills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, how'd you like to make a quick hundred bucks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man mutters something weakly. Ernie puts his ear up close to hear him better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says the pants don't usually come off for less than two-fifty, but since you're so cute, he'll make an exception.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: buried beneath rolls and rolls of bandages, making his wa through the protesters on crutches. Ernie helps him along nervously. As Rick spots Julie from behind, he hands the crutches over to Ernie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ernie takes the crutches. Rick waves his arms dramaticall clutches his bandaged legs, and winces in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help! Ow! Give me back my crutches! You monster! Oh, the pain! The agony!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He falls theatrically at Julie's feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay? Let me help you! 12.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Don't worry about me. What's one man's pain weighed against the global injustice of corporate tyrants like EES? Go. The fight must continue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie's buying it big time. She gazes deep into Rick's ey

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow... My name's Julie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh. Josh Tavner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ernie sticks a hand out, grinning sarcastically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother Theresa. Glad to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie turns on Ernie viciously. She slaps him hard, and grabs the crutches from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow! Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me those, ape. Help him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick rises to his feet "painfully."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Josh, a busload of us are headed over to Maracas to protest Noxon 24 and pelt Ricky Coogan with cow shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same here! You could ride with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Us? You're with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at Ernie, who grins stupidly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, he's okay. Have you ever heard of an idiot savant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Ernie. Except for the savant part. 13.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ernie glares at Rick. Rick smiles at Julie hopefully. Jul looks at them both, and can't help smiling herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ernie drives the battered old convertible which bears the proud logo of Santa Flan Rent-a-Car. There's a Pepsi billboard in the background. Julie massages Rick in the b seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (faking terrible pain) Ooooh, my pelvis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this better?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick moans and cracks a huge grin through his bandages. Ernie tries to get in on the conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Julie. You know I'm kind of an idea man myself. Like, let's say there's a nuclear war, and the only two people left are you and the Pope... Would you pork him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Disgusted, Julie smacks Ernie sharply and continues massa Rick. Scowling with jealousy, Ernie tries a new approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But one thing's for sure. That Coogan guy sure is an asshole, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll say! What a total piece of shit. Don't you think so, Josh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick grits his teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he's got a few problems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what a lousy actor! I mean can you believe that "Hey Dude" crap? 14.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, with a script that bad, Coogan deserves an Oscar for coming off as good as he did!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, that's what I read.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he's no Christian Slater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLATER!? I could act circles around that one-note hack! He was shittin' his diapers when I was the toast of Broadway! I made grown men cry! I made crippled children laugh! Now all I ever hear is Slater! Slater! Slater! WELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enraged, Rick rips the bandages off his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think Slater could improv like this? Make you believe he was an invalid!? Huh!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie stares at him in shock. Rick catches his breath, realizes what he's just done, and smiles weakly. Ernie tr to break the awkward silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, do you like Swedish films?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie gives him a murderous look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High wide shot: The car is descending deeper into the wil jungle, towards a huge eerie sunset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie's been lecturing Rick for some time now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't even want to hear the truth about Noxon, do you, Coogan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, look, I'm not saying this stuff is going to turn anyone into a... a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: on the road behind Julie he sees a crude carnival billboa featuring a painting of a huge worm with a man's head. It reads "See the Incredabel Humin Werm! Only at Elijah C. Skuggs Famus Freek Land." Julie can't see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Human worm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. A human worm. I mean, that's just stupid. The point is--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick sees another billboard for the freak show. This one features a half-man/half-dog creature and says "See the Aztownding Dawg Boy!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dog boy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, or a dog boy. That's absurd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another billboard. This one features the "Hidyous Frawg Man."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hideous frog man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay. Now you're just being silly. Human suffering's just a big joke to you, huh? You are sick, Coogan!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns away from him in a huff and looks out her windo She sees a billboard that reads "See The Hole Amazing Fam of Freekz at Elijah C. Skuggs Famus Freek Land and Mutent Emporeum!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool! A freak show! Let's check it out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kind of like a family reunion for you, huh? 16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lighten up, Coog, could be a goof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car turns into a driveway near a crude, hand painted that says "FreekzTM--Thiss waey" with a messy arrow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We ZOOM IN to the hand painted "small print" on the botto the sign, which reads--"Freekz is a registered trademark Elijah C. Skuggs Enterprises. Any unauthorized reproducti is strictly prohibited without prior written consent."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car stops at the end of the long, spooky driveway, ju past a sizzling electric fence. Rick, Julie, and Ernie ge out and look around. It's eerily quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a large dilapidated mining shed complete with ru ducts and a tall smoke stack, a tattered carnival tent wi an ornate stage flat facade, a lopsided outhouse, a creep broken-down farm house, and in the center of it all, a gi molded carnival head with big staring eyes, which slowly rotates on a creaky base.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ernie looks hard at the big eyes. He turns away for a second, then spins around again. The EYES are looking in different direction. Ernie shakes his head and unwraps a chocolate bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't it great? It's so "real"...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Real stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go. This place is dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Where are all the weirdos?

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: There are no weirdos here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Startled, they turn to see ELIJAH C. SKUGGS, a twisted, haggard old man. He takes a bite out of an ice cream cone which contains the rear half of a chipmunk with a marasch cherry on top. Elijah has bad teeth, a bad shave, and sca eyes. We now realize the giant head is molded in his imag 17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mutants, yes. Genetic nightmares, definitely. Children of Hell and twisted masses of living, breathing tormented flesh, certainly. But as for weirdos... not a one. Unless of course you count me! Ha ha ha!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, you seem like a regular dumbshit old redneck to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elijah ignores him. Julie shoots him a look and smiles at Elijah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Julie. And you are...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elijah C. Skuggs, proud proprietor of Skugg's Fabulous Freak Land and Mutant Emporium. But you knew that. After all, you've ventured miles away from civilization, hospitals, telephones,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: police... How may I help-you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elijah smiles, unfazed. Julie glares at Rick. She smiles apologetically at Elijah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd like to see your freak show. You see, only by appreciating the variety and innovation of nature can we come to respect the fragile complexity of our global eco- system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elijah nudges Ernie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you come to me looking for weirdos?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ernie shrugs. He goes to take a bite out of his chocolate bar and finds only the empty wrapper left in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! What the--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks behind him, and there--about ten feet away--is.. 18.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: warts all over, squatting on the ground and chewing happi This is TOAD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie and Rick turn and see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eeuuuwww... (composes herself and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahem. Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toad doesn't respond to her waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Toad is my... assistant. As for the show, I'm afraid the next parade of deformity isn't until tomorrow night...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick and Ernie pretend to be disappointed. They turn to leave. Julie's sincerely upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, just our luck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elijah grabs Rick's shoulder and turns him around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: However! I do have a private exhibit in my shed you might enjoy. I don't usually share it with the general public...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're deeply honored. But no thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. We really must be--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises his cigarette to his lips, but it's gone! He tu to see Toad, ten feet behind him, puffing away happily. Hmmm. Elijah is already leading Julie towards the shed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sideshow tradition has been misrepresented by the media. You don't traffic in human misery. You show society the part of itself it doesn't want to look at. 19.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... Yesm I see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks over to Rick and Ernie with a grin that says "Where'd you find this nutty chick?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick shrugs and follows, taking Ernie with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the heck. We'll see some pickled dog brains, maybe some pictures of women with, you know, added equipment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And to think we could be in the limo with those stewardesses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elijah holds the shed door open for them. It's pitch blac inside. Julie enters. Rick and Ernie follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell, Coog, these people are weird, but they seem nice enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sits outside the shed. THWAP! Toad lashes out with his te foot tongue, and sucks the bunny into his mouth. He shuff into the shed, crunching contentedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elijah closes the shed doors in our face, grinning. we he a lonq peal of EVIL LAUGHTER from inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dark and spooky. Elijah stands in a pool of light, reading a Family Circus cartoon in the funny pages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HA-HE-HE-HE! God I love the Family Circus! How do they do it day after day? It's amazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Toad finishes strapping them onto massive Frankenstein style operating tables. They struggle desperately against

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I guess they do use the same joke over and over. I'm just a sucker for that little moffet's shenanigans, that's all. (he tosses the funnies

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But perhaps I should tell you a little more about what I do. You see, I not only exhibit freaks, I make them. Just like Michelangelo saw the angel in the stone, I look at a guy like Kevin Costner and see a giant peach grub who can fart the Blue Danube! (mops brow, asks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I crazy or is it hot in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick, Julie, and Ernie shoot him a look that pretty well answers his question. Elijah shrugs and goes back to his spiel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behold! The Tasty Freekz machine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls a tarp off a huge complicated machine. Several drums and vats of various chemicals feed through a crude network of pipes, gadgets and computers into an old Tasty Freeze soft serve ice cream machine (The logo has been changed to "Tasty Freekz"). The biggest vat reads "NOXON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God! He's using Noxon Twenty- Four!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! You're not supposed to have that stuff!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh? Well, I guess I'm not supposed to have these either! 21.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds up a matching towel and washcloth embroidered wi the "Ramada Inn" logo. Rick, Julie, and Ernie gasp. He tosses the towels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Elijah gets worked up into a frenzy, the ambience in t room becomes more and more horrific: the sunlight is repl by an eerie green glow, a thunderstorm rumbles to life, a raven perches on the windowsill, a rat scurries across th floor, one of those plastic "Bony Banks" reaches out and grabs a quarter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need only punch a few buttons on this magnificent device, and it gives me an easy-to-apply ointment that will mutate a perfect young body, bubble its skin, warp its bones and twist its guts into AN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elijah's hair is now standing on end. He's foaming at the mouth. A bolt of lightning and THUNDERCLAP cap the monologue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. Does this mean we're not going to see a show?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toad, fire up that machine, and let's turn these hapless asswipes into monstrosities!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now let's see. Who wants to get freaked first?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points at Julie) Ladies first!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go screw yourself!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I were you, I would!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmmm. 22.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toad is adjusting some knobs on the machine. Elijah steps past him to a jerry-rigged computer console. He punches s keys and some rotating DNA models appear on the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mumbling to himself) It's like Yin and Yang... AC/DC... two birds with one stone... Yeah, it's pretty darn good, really...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He presses "enter" and the computer beeps. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let 'er rip, Toad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toad yanks a pull-start cord and the machine rumbles to l Elijah pulls the Tasty Freekz lever and fills a small dis with phosphorescent ointment. Toad cuts open their clothe exposing their sides, and pushes them close together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a second. You're really gonna smear that stuff on us and mutate our body parts!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Correct.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... then could you give me a really big rodney?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a mad scientist pal, not a miracle worker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elijah smears the ointment on their exposed sides. Their skin begins to bubble and undulate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God!... No!... Holy shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A grapefruit-sized lump pops up on Ernie's side, then ano on Julie's side, and then the lumps do a little synchroni dance together. Suddenly Ernie's flesh balloons out and melds into Julie's side. The mass of connected skin continues to bubble and mutate. Odd shapes press up under

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four humans faces that quickly become Mount Rushmore...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pepsi logo--"Pepsi: The Choice of a New Generation".. Julie and Ernie merge into one amorphous flesh blob which then takes the form of... 23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Demon versions of GUMBY and his magic horse POKEY. Gumby' got his back to camera. He's grabbing his crotch and flipping everyone off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gumby! Put that thing away!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gumby and Pokey mutate back into a blob and then into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: joined side to side, their two heads on a single body whi is split down the middle--half Julie, half Ernie. Elijah wheels a large mirror in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feast your eyes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, at least I'll never have to go far for a piece of tail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pig!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She SMACKS him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ouch! I was just trying to keep things light. Oh God! Why me!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts blubbering uncontrollably. Toad drags them towa the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother always said there'd be days like this. And I thought she was nuts!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They exit. Elijah turns to Rick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gestures to Julie/Ernie) A mere party trick. But you, you're gonna be special.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elijah steps over to the computer console and starts punc keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me go, Skuggs, or else!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got some RICK(cont'd) friends that'll come down here and mess you up bad, homey! (Elijah chuckles. Rick tries a different

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got some other friends who can score you box seats at the Superbowl, no problem.

dialogues.speaker: YOU FUCKIN' APE
dialogues.text: (switches gears again) You ever had a hot fudge bath with Morgana? [foreign take: Madonna]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick nods hopefully. Elijah considers it for a moment, th frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, screw it. I'd never get anywhere with her. TOAD! FIRE UP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toad starts the machine. Elijah pulls the lever and dispenses a bowl full of glowing ointment. He carries it towards Rick, leering maniacally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For years I've strived to create the ultimate monster. The first of a whole new generation of superfreaks! Now I've finally got you, the perfect subject--a real asshole! HA-HA- (he pauses and looks closer at Rick) Wait a minute. Aren't you the guy from "Hey Dude Three-The Beguiling?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were great in that picture! Oh well, I guess for the next one they'll have to get Christian Slater! HA-HA-HA! 25.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elijah squishes the ointment into Rick's horrified face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The barn looks especially sinister silhouetted against a green moon. A huge ball of flame belches out of the smoke stack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's eerily quiet in the dawn light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Extreme close-up of Rick's eye as it opens, and searches room frantically. Close-up of Rick's hand--a normal hand- straining at the bonds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICK's POV groggily searches the lab, and picks up the blurred image of Elijah in the distance. He's on the phon speaking in hushed tones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Red Swan. May I speak to the Laughing Man?... Yes, I'll hold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a moment, Elijah is entertained by hold music to the of "Freak Out," by Chic. A man's laughing voice comes on other end of the line. It laughs throughout the "conversation".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laughing Man? Red Swan. I've done it! I found the perfect subject-- huge ego, shallow personality, almost no moral values... A lawyer? No, better. An actor. Yeah, the guy from those hilarious "Hey Dude" movies! Hahahaha--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laughing man has stopped laughing. Elijah dummies up. 26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I liked 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laughing man resumes laughing. Elijah listens intently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right... Yes... Yes, I see... But that's just it. He's not quite, uh, finished. I need more Noxon so I can--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laughing Man laughs so loudly Elijah has to hold the phon away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geez, what a grouch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over on the slab, Rick groans. He's waking up. Elijah notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Laughing man) Laughing Man? I have to go. What about the Noxon? Two days? Great, you can see everything then... Yeah, you take it easy too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elijah hangs up the phone, and strides over towards Rick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wakey, wakey. Time to meet and greet the new you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He flips the slab right-side up, and holds up a mirror. Rick's eyes widen in terror as he beholds his hideous new form. Rick's left half has been transformed into a hideou bug-eyed monster!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AAaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaargh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BANG! The doors fly open. Elijah drags Rick out. Horrified, Rick clutches the monster side of his face. 27.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God! This was my good side!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still is if you ask me! Hell, even half-done, you'll be the star of the show tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elijah stops in front of the tiny outhouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to your spacious accommodations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He unlocks the door and drags Rick in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oddly, the interior is a vast barracks, fifty feet long a thirty feet high. Rick looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great use of the space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I learned it all from Bob Vila.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOB VILA walks up next to Elijah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know you could expose those rustic beams and put in a skylight over one weekend, Elijah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it a rest, Bob!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes Bob away into the freak house, gives Rick a goo wink and walks out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elijah pauses and looks at the tiny outhouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of these days I gotta put a shitter in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob Vila steps out of nowhere again, holding a Time-Life book. 28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem. It's all here in my Beds and Bathrooms book, Elijah. And you pay nothing for thirt--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BONK! Elijah knocks him out cold with a ball-peen hammer from his tool belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It takes a few moments for Rick's eyes to adjust to the d light. There's nobody in sight. The walls are lined with dark cubicles, stacked atop each other with walkways like prison cells. Rick staggers to his feet, and makes his wa forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ernie? Julie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over here, Coog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick sees the vague outline of JulieErnie a few yards awa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that voice. That's the voice that said,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Cool, a freak show. Let's check it out!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What!? Oh sure, blame the woman. Typical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "It's so real." Is this real enough for you? I'm friggin' Quasimodo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chill out, Coog. You're talking to the original tag team of ugly pukes. Step into the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, here I come. 29.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick steps forward into a pool of light. Julie and Ernie caught by surprise. Julie struggles to keep her composure Ernie's repulsed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ernie turns away and pukes on the floor. Julie soldiers o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh geez... It's not so (GULP) revolting. After all, physical beauty is just a socially-enforced myth that we, uh, oh shit... ULPI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie turns away and pukes on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, you're no Mona Lisas yourself. You're lucky I've got a strong stomach!

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (O.C.)
dialogues.text: And you're lucky I don't BITE you! Heh heh heh heh ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick wheels around to see JUAN THE DOG BOY, snickering be him. Juan is a hairy young Mexican with a snout, dog ears and canine teeth--Scrappy Doo with an attitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick assumes a threatening pose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away from me you, you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freak? Ha ha hahahaha! (he stares hard at Rick) I am Juan the Dog Boy, leader of the freaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (walks up to them) Kind of the "top dog."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juan scratches himself behind the ear with his hind leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to Hell, Rick. Shake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He extends a hand to Rick. Rick doesn't take it. He hears slight RUSTLING noise from the direction of the cubicles, turns to look around the apparently empty Freak House. 30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks. I don't plan on staying long. How many of you are there in here anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juan shrugs mischievously and sticks his snout in Rick's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First, I have a question for you, Ricardo. Who starred in the film "International Velvet?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, perhaps we should ask the Worm!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The top right cubicle lights up, revealing the WORM. He i man with no arms and legs, and the wrinkly, slimy body of worm. His face is learned-looking, with spectacles, a sma goatee, and a pipe which he puffs on pompously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell us, Worm, who starred in "International Velvet?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puffs pensively on his pipe for a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, yes ... very interesting... International Velvet... The perfectly appalling sequel to National Velvet, I believe. No dramatic verisimilitude whatsoever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Worm. But who was the star?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The worm takes a long, thoughtful drag on his pipe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olivia DeHavilland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olivia DeHavilland... Rick, do you agree or disagree?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is nuts. This is crazy... Besides, it was Tatum O'Neill. 31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very good. It was Tatum O'Neill, now married to tennis star John McEnroe. Circle gets the square.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights come on in 9 of the center cubicles, silhouett 9 freaks in a full size HOLLYWOOD SQUARES 3 x 3 layout. T FREAKS applaud Rick's success. He's incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yayyy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worm nudges an "0" into place in his cubicle, with some difficulty. He's not happy about being proved wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blast. O'Neill ... No talent ragamuffin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: okay, JulieErnie, your turn. Who's it going to be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Juan names the freaks one by one, their square is highlighted, and they wave at Rick cheerily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nosey the Nose Man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NOSEY is a man whose massive nose dominates his head. He blows into a huge hanky, and waves it wearily at Rick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cowboy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COWBOY is a young boy with cow-like features, a cowboy ha cowboy clothes, and a full set of udders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bearded Lady!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BEARDED LADY is a big, tough, bearded man--in a blous He has lipstick, earrings, and tattoos on his muscular ar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gruff and masculine) How ya' doin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sockhead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOCKHEAD is a freak with a large button-eyed sock puppet a head. He's munching cookies which ,spill uselessly out his throatless sock mouth... 32.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Human Torch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HUMAN TORCH is a man engulfed in flames. He waves apathetically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosie the Pinhead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROSIE is a pinhead in dark sunglasses. She has a great bo jammed into a sexy dress. She smokes a cigarette demurely and waves a small, arrogant big-star wave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hideous Frog Man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frogman is just a guy in a scuba outfit. He strikes a threatening "monster" pose, then gives a friendly wave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And of course, in the center square, Mr. Paul Lynde!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the lighting changes to flashing red horror ligh with plenty of dark shadows. There's a horrific MUSIC STI and we ZOOM IN to a DECOMPOSING SKELETON in the center cubicle. Its eyeball drips out of the socket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well JulieErnie, who will it be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call me old-fashioned, but I'll go with Paul Lynde.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be an idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They argue back and forth, hitting and poking each other Stooges style. Juan turns to Rick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see, Rick? Just because we're freaks doesn't mean we can't have some fun, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick is overwhelmed by it all. He backs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away from me. Get away! I'm not like you. You hear me? I'm Ricky Coogan! I AM NOT A FREAK! 33.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Freaks laugh in Rick's face. He storms off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick sits in a corner, pondering his fate. Oddly, there's shiny new Pepsi machine in this dingy corner of the Freak House. JulieErnie approach him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay Coog, so I get twenty four hour access to T `n' A, and you look like a plate of rancid giblets. We're still pals, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick shoots him a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the freaks have gone through this anguish, Rick. At first, I was blinded by my anger. I admit it. I wanted to break your neck for getting me into this. But I got over it. Juan taught me to channel my anger for the common good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was your fault, anyway. You wanted to see the freak show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tries to wring his neck. Ernie helps. Rick glares at Ernie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ernie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... Sorry, Coog. For a second there, I was a total man-hater. Weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie regains her cool. She takes out a pamphlet, scribbl something on it, and hands it to Rick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. Take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick examines the cover. He reads it aloud. 34.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "So You're a Hideous Mutant Freak-- Now What?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's an "8" scribbled on the pamphlet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: we're in cubicle eight. Maybe later you'll be ready to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it. Not me. I'm not like those other god-forsaken animals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws the-pamphlet to the ground, just as the Worm, Bearded Lady, and Sockhead approach. They sit down in a circle around him. The Worm looks down at the pamphlet an puffs thoughtfully on his pipe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're mistaken, Rick. You are exactly like us. We were all normal healthy folk before we made the fateful mistake of visiting this hell hole at an off hour. Why, when I first came here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Worm, as an OXFORD PROFESSOR, is wandering around the grounds, taking notes and puffing on his pipe.

dialogues.speaker: WORM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I was a professor of lacrophylogy-- er, the study of worms, of course. I came in search of the Epsosophecci dilepsidae--in layman terms, the fat pudgy worm. Mr. Skuggs said he had just such a worm in his shed. How could I have surmised that the specimen and I would ultimately prove to be one and the same?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see professor Worm meet Elijah, and follow him into th lab. The smoke stack belches a plume of flames as we hear his off-camera screams. DISSOLVE back to..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Worm finishes his tale. 35.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At first, the transformation was fabulous. I truly understood the worm's ethos like never before. But those early days of fascination are over. Now, in retrospect, I think the whole thing is a fucking headache. I'd sell my soul just to be able to wipe my own ass...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sniffles a little, but manages to hold back the tears. pan to Sockhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I first came here as a tourist, looking for some fun...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lanky TOURIST, obviously Sockhead in better days. He approaches Elijah.

dialogues.speaker: SOCKHEAD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Anyway, then Elijah turned me into a sock. That's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sockhead shrugs apologetically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. I'm not much for stories.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera moves in on the BEARDED LADY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I arrived here, I was nothing like I am now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bearded lady (as a man) steps out of the cab of his eighteen-wheeler. He looks very much like he does now, except he has no lipstick or earrings. 36.

dialogues.speaker: BEARDED LADY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I was confused--a walking contradiction, so full of questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He finishes his story.

dialogues.speaker: BEARDED LADY/MAN
dialogues.text: Now I know who I am. I can say, "Hey world. This is me. I'm a woman. And I like me."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others look at the bearded man uneasily. The camera p past the Bearded Lady, and moves in on an ordinary HAMMER lying on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy music. The hammer is placed on a shelf by a friendl STOCKBOY. The music turns tense as Elijah appears and sca the shelf. He makes eye contact with the hammer, and smil He grabs the hammer roughly and shoves it in a plastic ba Darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bag opens, Elijah reaches in and takes out the hammer The music turns to Psycho-like string stabs as Elijah use the hammer to smash in a nail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone looks at the hammer sympathetically. Rick turns away to wipe a tear from his eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are one of us now, Rick. Whether you admit it or not. It's irrefutable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Says you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The worm shakes his head. The freaks turn and head back t their cubicles. Rick exchanges a look with Julie before s and Ernie turn and head off. 37.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick is left alone, staring pensively at the hammer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hours later, Rick is still staring at the hammer. He pick it up and stares at it more closely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hours later. Rick is still staring at the damn hammer. He nods with resolve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He spots the pamphlet on the ground, picks it up, dusts i off. He opens it and begins to read, under the heading "1 It's Fun Being Ugly!"...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick closes the pamphlet, looks at the number "8" Julie scribbled, and nods with a sense of purpose. Standing up, throws the hammer carelessly aside into the muck, and wal towards the cubicles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick walks past the cubicles. In one, the Bearded Lady kn a sweater... He reaches cubicle 8, and is about to speak when he hears Julie giggling. There is a man's voice, but not Ernie's. It's Juan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick peeks around and sees Julie scratching Juan's belly. licks her face happily, and she giggles with delight. Ern is reading "The Woman's Room," trying not to notice all o this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick watches, disgusted. He tears up the pamphlet, throws to the ground, and storms off to find his own cubicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ernie peeks at Julie and Juan continuing their foreplay. Juan stops abruptly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Mind your business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. 38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ernie returns to his book. The camera PANS up to Rick's cubicle. He's sitting on his cot, distractedly whittling log with his knife-like talon. He talks to himself, makin sure to be loud enough for JulieErnie and Juan to hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well that EES guy should rescue me any minute. Then it's straight to the plastic surgeon and back to sunny old L.A. I wonder how many of my beautiful, anatomically correct girlfriends will be waiting for me.

dialogues.speaker: STUEY GLUCK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I'll be waiting for you, Rick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Stuey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick looks up and sees a holographic image of Stuey Gluck floating in the air above him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AHH! A phantom troll!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He swings the log wildly at the hologram, but it keeps darting around, dodging the blows. Cowboy leans around th cubicle wall. He talks a lot like Gomer Pyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seeing phantom trolls, Rick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick stops swinging, lamely pretends he was stretching, a ignores Stuey, who hovers around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds to me like you've developed a telepathic bond. Don't mean yer nuts or nuthin'. Heck, old Nosey, why he can smell the future. Lots of us freaks got E.S.P. And Sockhead, he's got E.S.P.N.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points at Sockhead, who's watching pro wrestling on a portable TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch out, Hulk! He's gonna try the skull cracker! 39.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shucks, Rick, you're lucky. Telepathy like yours only occurs between real soulmates. A bond like that should be cherished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cowboy smiles and ducks back into his own cubicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow! I'm Ricky Coogan's soulmate!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In your dreams! Now get lost, troll!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He swings wildly at the hologram, which starts to break u and fade away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait'll I tell the kids at school!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuey disappears. Cowboy leans into Rick's cubicle again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shucksm Rick, it don't make sense to spurn your soulmate. I reckon that troll could help you if you just let him into your heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick scoffs at him and starts whittling again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a cramped room filled with Ricky Coogan memorabilia. Stuey is drawing a crude sketch of Rick on a pad. This sequence is set to brassy "man on a mission" music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once America sees what happened to Ricky, they'll probably send the whole FBI down to save him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuey marches towards a frosted glass door that reads "TH LOS ANGELES TIMES". 40.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll probably win a Pulitzer prize for this scoop. And I'll dedicate it to Rick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks through the door. Beat. SMASH! He comes flying out through the glass and lands on his butt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE "TIME MAGAZINE" DOOR--SMASH! Stuey flies out through

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE "U.S.A. TODAY" DOOR--SMASH! Stuey flies out through i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE "WEEKLY WORLD NEWS" DOOR--We see Stuey and an EDITOR silhouetted against the glass.

dialogues.speaker: EDITOR, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Of course I'll print it! America needs to know! Burt! Give mister Gluck his fee and show him out.

dialogues.speaker: STUEY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: That's okay. I know the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SMASH! Stuey dives through the glass door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuey proudly reads the weekly world News. The front page features Stuey's story and his sketch of Rick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Freaky Deaky! Ricky Coogan's a mutant in South America! By Stuart S. Gluck." (to NEWSSTAND GUY) That's me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly two GOONS in dark suits snatch the paper away fr Stuey. They grab him and force him into a limousine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Goons hold Stuey in between them.'He's terrified. we hear the low, menacing chuckle of the Laughing Man, who's screen. The camera is his POV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heh heh heh heh hehh heh. 41.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure I wrote the article. But--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha-ha-ha!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You've got it all wrong. I don't know anything about that. You gotta believe me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ho-ho-hahahaha hee hee hoohaaa!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: cruises off down the street. We hear a POWER DRILL, Stuey SCREAMS, and Laughing Man's hearty CACKLE from inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick has whittled his log down to a toothpick. He admires it, then leans over and fits it into an intricate three-f scale model of the Eiffel Tower, made entirely out of toothpicks. The Human Torch walks by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, what a great model! (he points at a toothpick) But look, this one's crooked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches out to fix it and--WOOF! The whole model burns a cinder. Rick looks at him hatefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elijah steps into the freakhouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, freaks! Get ready for the glamour! Get ready for the glitz! Get ready to be pelted with rotten vegetables, 'cause it's showtime!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elijah, looking natty in his Ringmaster suit, stands at t entrance, barking to various people who are drifting in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's grisly! It's revolting! It'll make you wish you were dead! And at just twelve bucks a head, you can bring all the kids!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow a KINDLY FATHER through the curtained entrance. OOF! He collapses, a knife embedded in his chest, reveali the total mayhem...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The motley crowd (LOCALS, sleazy looking MOBSTERS, rogue BIKERS, wayward HIPPIES, and JAPANESE TOURISTS, etc.) is brawling and drinking and having a heck of a time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some small displays and a few carnival booths are set up around the sides of the tent. There's a "PETTING ZOO" whe a KID is petting a two-tailed-no-headed dog. And there's "HEAVY PETTING ZOO" where a GUY is french kissing a six- legged goat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CLOWN sits in a dunk tank, heckling the customers. The sign says "DUNK ME IN ACID!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, my granny could throw better than you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's talking to an OLD LADY, who throws a baseball, hits target, and dunks the clown into the foaming bath of carb acid. We hear his gurgling screams, then his bony hand reaches up out of the bath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elijah walks out on stage and looks at the rowdy audience It's total mayhem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone instantly sits down, shuts up, and looks up obediently at Elijah. 43.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Ladies and gentlemen, you are about to witness a cavalcade of atrocities so horrific, I advise the more sensitive members of our audience to leave the premises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two SENSITIVE LOOKING MEN wearing sweaters draped over th shoulders politely get up and leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight I'm proud to announce the addition of several new monstrosities to the show, including our star attraction, the Beast Boy--an untamed and highly dangerous ghoul who's liable to go nuts and kill us all at the drop of a hat. (impressed "oohs", "ahhs", and "cools" from the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But first up, prepare to behold an unspeakably repulsive yet heartwarming atrocity, Three Men and a Baby!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE MEN AND A BABY, all fused into a single multi-limbe freak, walks out onstage. One of its arms holds up a dirt diaper, and all the three men hold their noses and grimac The audience breaks into warm-hearted laughter and applau

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The freaks mill around in the caged-in green room, guarde Toad. Frogman, dressed in a magician's outfit over his wetsuit, holds an empty dove cage and searches the room, whistling for his missing dove. Nosey sneezes up a cloud feathers. JulieErnie walk determinedly towards the adjace Men's and Women's restrooms... BONK! They hit the wall between the two doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick is reading his "script", rehearsing his lines. He's wearing a cheesy "jungle" costume.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arrrggg. I am Beast Boy. I will eat you. Arrrghh. (he throws down the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do this shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He peers through the bars, scanning the audience for sign a rescue party. 44.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it! What's keeping those guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Worm creeps up behind Rick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's troubling you, my boy. what is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, let's see. I've been kidnapped, hideously disfigured, imprisoned with a bunch of mutant freaks, my rescue party is M.I.A., and this dialogue makes "Hey Dude Three" read like "Dr. Zhivago."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I know what you're going through. I too had an eating disorder. You see, I've always had a feverish obsession with pudding. And when I was a young lad...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick groans and looks out at the audience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: onstage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now a perennial favorite here at Freakland, ladies and gentlemen. I know you'll all enjoy the musical stylings of Rosie the Pinhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosie the Pinhead struts out wearing a sexy dress and hol a microphone. After the applause dies down, she whips off her sunglasses with a flourish, revealing her extremely g looking crossed eyes. She wails incomprehensibly and bonk her head with the mic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A series of WIPES show bits of various acts as the evenin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: are doing a Vaudeville style stand-up routine while tap dancing. 45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Julie, how many feminists does it take to screw in a light bulb?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two. One to screw it in and one to ride my Rodney! Ha-ha-ha!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oaf!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She bonks him with their cane. He bonks her back. She knocks him cold. They both fall down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is doing a make-over demonstration. He's got a local GIRL from the audience sitting at a makeup table onstage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If your coloring is in the autumn range, like Maria's, try an earth tone eye makeup. Now I've done a lovely French braid on Maria, but I encourage everyone to experiment and use your imagination. The main thing is to just have fun with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The audience is engrossed. Some take notes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is ringing those "tuned bells" and singing along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edelweiss, Edelweiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a bow but his sock is snagged on the mic stand. pulls off and reveals a normal-sized hand where the sockh was--he's actually a hand-head! The audience gasps. A MAN gets up and points accusingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got a hand under there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a hoax!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sockhead realizes he's unveiled and tries to hide his han head with his other hands. The crowd starts jeering and pelting Sockhead with rotten vegetables. He gives them th finger with all three hands. Elijah tries to calm them. 46.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puppetteering is an admirable skill in its own right! Give him his due!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the beast boy you promised us!? Bring on the beast boy! We want the beast boy! (etc.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Worm is still talking to Rick. We can hear the crowd screaming for him in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when I won first prize, they never called me pudding-head again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you see? You must turn your hardship into inspiration! You're an actor, Rick! Your body is your instrument, and with it you must play your tragic symphony for all the world!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick is really moved. Elijah pokes his head backstage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're going nuts for you, Beast Boy! You better go out there now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to take off his jungle costume.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (determined, inspired) I'll be right there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you Worm. I don't really know how I can repay you for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could wipe my ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinks Worm is joking) Ha-ha! Always the wit, eh Worm? 47.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick claps him on the back and walks off. Worm is disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn. (he turns to Nosey) Nosey, have I ever told you what a gifted artist you are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nosey gives him a worried look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The spotlight reveals Rick, centerstage, poised in Shakespearean garb. The crowd quiets down and focuses on Rick with great respect and awe. A truly dramatic silence Rick pauses for effect and then launches into a soliloquy with bravura.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now is the winter of our discontent, Made glorious summer by this son of York, But I that am not shaped for sportive tricks, Nor made to court an amorous looking glass, I, that am curtailed of this fair proportion, Cheated of feature by dissembling nature,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The audience is riveted. Even Spanish-speaking peasants a mouthing the words. Elijah, however, thumbs through his script, totally confused. The freaks watch through the ba from the wings--completely engrossed, especially Julie. J notices this and pulls her closer to him, but she pushes away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We move in on an erudite British gentlemen in the crowd. God! It's ALISTAIR COOKE! He turns to camera. Subtitle: ALISTAIR COOKE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're having trouble understanding Mr. Coogan's brilliant reading of this soliloquy from Richard the Third, please take advantage of the handy subtitles for the culturally illiterate. 48.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FILTHY PEASANT sitting next to Cooke is trying to liste Rick. He turns angrily to Cooke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooke turns back to the stage. The words in brackets appe as SUBTITLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deformed, unfinished, sent before my time,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Into this breathing world, scarse half made up,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that so lamely and unfashionable, That dogs bark at me as I halt by them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why I, in this weak piping time of peace,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have no delight to pass away the time,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless to see my shadow in the sun, And descant on mine own deformity!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick bows. The crowd bursts into applause. They yell "Bravo" and throw bouquets. Rick takes several curtain calls. The freaks cheer for him. Julie is particularly moved--she and Rick exchange a heavy look, laden with romantic potential. NOTE: We will insert an almost subliminal one-frame shot of the Pepsi logo at this triumphant moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin, the EES executive from the airport scene, walks in the tent. Rick sees him and gasps with joy. He leaps off the stage, runs up to Kevin and hugs him. Kevin is shocke of course. Overcome by the moment, Rick regresses to his self.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm saved! Haha! You sorry mutants are gonna rot in this hole while I'm sipping mint juleps by the pool!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The freaks and the audience gasp at Rick's cruelty. Julie shocked--Juan gives her an "I told you so" look. Rick see Julie and catches himself. 49.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, um, I hope you have room for all my friends, heh-heh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick, Rick, listen, I really love this new look you've come up with. But just between you and me, I don't think the guys upstairs would really get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you saying!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm saying you're ugly enough to burn the nosehairs off a dead nun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd bursts into cruel hysterics, pointing mockingly Rick. Even Alistair Cooke is practically choking with laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick looks around, horrified at the sea of evil, jeering faces. He begins to tremble. Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: springs to life for the first time and glows red with rag His whole monster side awakens and takes charge of his bo with violent intensity. He grabs Kevin's head and screams a new, monstrous voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POP! He plucks Kevin's head off his neck and holds it alo The head stares down at Rick in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you're just being childish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick serves the head like a volleyball, smashing it to bi The crowd panics and charges for the exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People are trampling over each other in the mayhem. Alist Cooke is crushed under the stampede. 50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The freaks are horrified. Monster Rick growls triumphantl Elijah looks on, intrigued.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that's entertainment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick awakens with a start and gets up. He approaches JulieErnie, The Bearded Lady, Nosey and Dog Boy, who are playing a game of "Wheel of Fortune." The cubicles contai large blank blocks, like the "letters" on the game show. far, there's a "D", two "S"s, and a "K" revealed. Rosie t Pinhead plays Vanna White's role.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
